name: hypothetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is imagined or suggested but not necessarily real or true: Any electronic voting system is hypothetically hackable. Hypothetically speaking, caffeine does affect circulation. See
hypothetical
More examplesFewer examplesThe company’s quick decision could hypothetically open it up to legal action. One intelligence official would speak only hypothetically about companies that want to launder money.Hypothetically, partisan election judges could allow in voters from their own party while barring others.
